title: Welfare Act 2020 (No. 30 of 2020)) and section 292 (amended by section 8(1)
heading: 3. (1) This article applies to a person who is, or becomes, entitled to—
text_raw:
3. (1) This article applies to a person who is, or becomes, entitled to— 

(a) 

a payment specified in article 4 of these Regulations in respect 
of the relevant week, 

or 

(b) domiciliary care allowance in respect of the period commencing 

on 1 April 2023 and expiring on 30 April 2023. 

(2) In the case of a person to whom this article applies, the specified 
payment payable to that person in respect of the relevant week shall be 
increased by €200.00. 

(3) A person shall not be entitled to an increase in accordance with subarticle (2) of this article in respect of more than one payment specified in 
article 4 of these Regulations.

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for a once-off bonus payment of €200.00 to 
recipients of social welfare payments and domiciliary care allowance during 
the month of April 2023. 

The bonus payment applies to recipients of the following social welfare 
payments— 

carer’s allowance; 
carer’s benefit; 

(a) back to work family dividend; 
(b) blind pension; 
(c) 
(d) 
(e) death benefit under the Occupational Injury Benefit scheme 
payable to widows, widowers, surviving civil partners, orphans 
and dependant parents; 
deserted wife’s benefit, and deserted wife’s allowance; 

(f) 
(g) disability allowance; 
(h) disablement pension; 
(i) 
farm assist; 
(j) 
guardian’s (contributory) payment; 
(k) guardian’s payment (non-contributory); 
(l) 

(p) 

(o) 

(m) 
(n) 

illness benefit in respect of an aggregate period of not less than 
312 days 
invalidity pension; 
jobseeker’s allowance in respect of a period of unemployment of 
at least 12 months; 
jobseeker’s benefit in respect of a period of unemployment of at 
least 12 months; 
jobseeker’s benefit (self-employed) in respect of a period of 
unemployment of at least 12 months; 
(q) 
jobseeker’s benefit for claimants over 65 years of age; 
(r) 
jobseeker’s transitional payment; 
(s) 
one-parent family payment; 
(t) 
partial capacity benefit; 
(u) State pension (contributory); 
(v) State pension (non-contributory); 
(w) widow’s, widower’s and surviving civil partner’s (contributory) 

pension; 

(x) widow’s, widower’s and surviving civil partner’s (non-

contributory) pension.
